briefTitle: Is Adrenal Insufficiency Under-diagnosed in Hospitalized Cirrhosis Patients?

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age \>=18 years
* Diagnosis of cirrhosis
* Admission to hospital

Exclusion Criteria:

* Age \< 18 years
* Prior enrollment in study (i.e. readmission)
* Prisoner
* Pregnancy
* Prednisone or Hydrocortisone use in last 24 hours

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Cholesterol Esterification Deficiency
outcomeMeasures.description: A percent quantification of serum cholesterol esterification will be measured via blood draw. Low values represent deficiency in esterification, which is a surrogate measure of lecthicin-cholesterol acetyltransferase (LCAT) enzymatic deficiency.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Spur Cell Anemia
outcomeMeasures.description: A peripheral blood smear will be obtained and assessed for presence of acanthocytes (spur cells). Spur cell anemia is defined as a serum hemoglobin \< 10g/dL and the presence of \>= 5% spur cells on blood smear.

outcomeMeasures.title: Participant Transplant-Free Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Transplant and Death are considered equivalent outcomes

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Relative Adrenal Insufficiency (RAI)
outcomeMeasures.description: A baseline total cortisol level will be obtained and then patients will receive a standard-dose synthetic ACTH (250mcg of Cosyntropin) stimulation test to assess for the presence of adrenal insufficiency. RAI is defined as a change in the total cortisol level in response to the stimulation test of \<9mcg/dL when measured 60 minutes after the Cosyntropin is administered.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Low Free Cortisol
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients will have their free cortisol levels measured to assess for deficiency.
